cmCourseInfo.description: An introduction to the main elements of the Italian language. The development of speaking, reading, and writing skills. Introduction to Italian culture and texts.
cmCourseInfo.title: Italian Language for Beginners
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: Grade 11 and/or 12 Italian (U or M level) or previous experience or instruction in Italian.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students will be asked to fill out a questionnaire in order to make sure that they are placed in the proper course for their knowledge of Italian.

Delivery Instructions

This course features a shared, pre-recorded asynchronous component delivered online to all students in the course. This component will take on average about one hour for every class meeting. This section of the course is self-paced and not reliant on a meeting schedule, but students will have to complete it before the active learning sessions of the course (consisting of 2 hours of instruction), which are live-streamed, delivered synchronously per the meeting schedule. In summary, because this is a Y course, it consists of 2 asynchronous hours + 4 synchronous hours every week. Students need to use several functions within Quercus (Discussion Boards, BB Collaborate), the ability to use MS Teams and/or Zoom for interactive sessions, a webcam and a microphone. Students are expected to keep cameras on all the time.

courses.name: Mediaeval Italian Literature in Translation: Petrarch and Boccaccio

cmCourseInfo.description: A study of Petrarch's Canzoniere and of Boccaccio's Decameron in relation to later Middle Ages. This course includes a component designed to enhance students' research experience. (Given in English)
cmCourseInfo.title: Mediaeval Italian Literature in Translation: Petrarch and Boccaccio

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

ONLINE SYNCHRONOUS

Lectures and any discussions and/or activities will be delivered online synchronously per the meeting schedule. Students will need to use several functions within Quercus (Discussion Boards, BB Collaborate) and the ability to use MS Teams and/or Zoom.

It is necessary that students have a computer with a microphone and camera in order to participate in online activities. Students are expected to have cameras on all the time.

cmCourseInfo.description: Based on a professor’s research project currently in progress, this course will enable an undergraduate student to play a useful role in the project while receiving concrete training in research. This course is mandatory for all students enrolled in the specialist’s program.
cmCourseInfo.title: Directed Research

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

For 'E' indicator courses: contact the Undergraduate Coordinator at 416-978-6304 or italian.undergrad@utoronto.ca for an appointment.

Delivery Instructions

Timing of lectures and meetings to be determined by instructors. In-person meetings with instructor only if allowed. Students will need to use several functions within Quercus (Discussion Boards, BB Collaborate) and the ability to use MSTeams or Zoom for interactive sessions. Students are expected to have cameras on all the time
